t: Proverbs 1
The Beginning of Knowledge
The*p proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
To*pn know wisdom and instruction, to*ld understand words of insight,
to*ln receive instruction in wise dealing, in*ld righteousness, justice, and equity;
to*ln give prudence to the simple, knowledge*ld and discretion to the youth—
Let*ln the wise hear and increase in learning, and*ld the one who understands obtain guidance,
to*ln understand a proverb and a saying, the*ld words of the wise and their riddles.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of knowledge; fools*ld despise wisdom and instruction.
The Enticement of Sinners
Hear,*pn my son, your father’s instruction, and*ld forsake not your mother’s teaching,
for*ln they are a graceful garland for your head and*ld pendants for your neck.
My*ln son, if sinners entice you, do*ld not consent.
If*ln they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood; let*ld us ambush the innocent without reason;
like*ln Sheol let us swallow them alive, and*ld whole, like those who go down to the pit;
we*ln shall find all precious goods, we*ld shall fill our houses with plunder;
throw*ln in your lot among us; we*ld will all have one purse”—
my*ln son, do not walk in the way with them; hold*ld back your foot from their paths,
for*ln their feet run to evil, and*ld they make haste to shed blood.
For*ln in vain is a net spread in*ld the sight of any bird,
but*ln these men lie in wait for their own blood; they*ld set an ambush for their own lives.
Such*ln are the ways of everyone who is greedy for unjust gain; it*ld takes away the life of its possessors.
The Call of Wisdom
Wisdom*pn cries aloud in the street, in*ld the markets she raises her voice;
at*ln the head of the noisy streets she cries out; at*ld the entrance of the city gates she speaks:
“How*ln long, O simple ones, will you love being simple? How*ln long will scoffers delight in their scoffing and*ld fools hate knowledge?
If*ln you turn at my reproof, behold,*ln I will pour out my spirit to you; I*ld will make my words known to you.
Because*ln I have called and you refused to listen, have*ld stretched out my hand and no one has heeded,
because*ln you have ignored all my counsel and*ld would have none of my reproof,
I*ln also will laugh at your calamity; I*ld will mock when terror strikes you,
when*ln terror strikes you like a storm and*ld your calamity comes like a whirlwind, when*ld distress and anguish come upon you.
Then*ln they will call upon me, but I will not answer; they*ld will seek me diligently but will not find me.
Because*ln they hated knowledge and*ld did not choose the fear of the Lord,*s
would*ln have none of my counsel and*ld despised all my reproof,
therefore*ln they shall eat the fruit of their way, and*ld have their fill of their own devices.
For*ln the simple are killed by their turning away, and*ld the complacency of fools destroys them;
but*ln whoever listens to me will dwell secure and*ld will be at ease, without dread of disaster.”
